item.title: Unix Sleight of Hand (2/?): Robust Column Extraction
item.description: Many Bioinformaticians spend a lot of their time handling text files. Linux (and other Unixes) excel at processing text files and offer many tools for handling it. However, extracting a particular column from text files is surprisingly hard. This blog post explores some robust solutions.

item.title: Unix Sleight of Hand (1/?): Bash Job Control
item.description: This post deals with the basics “and beyond” of job control in Bash. The Bourne Again Shell (Bash) arguably is the most widely used POSIX-compliant shell. It has been around since 1989 and is still alive and kicking.
